result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Philip M. Bradshaw was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Philip M. Bradshaw was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Philip M. Bradshaw was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

ADDRESS INFO for Philip M. Bradshaw
Current: 16715 Ne 11Th St, Vancouver, WA 98784   (Effective: 07-19-2017)
Prior: 16715 Ne 11th St, Vancouver, WA 98684

Defendant Philip M. Bradshaw in court with attorney Erik C. Johnson.  Defendant Philip M. Bradshaw in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that the PSI has been received by all parties.  Atty Hendee states that in speaking with Atty Johnson; the defendant is going to withdraw his plea and the State is not contesting that withdrawal due to the State filing an amended information which adds Counts 3 & 4, Obstructing an Officer.
  Atty Hendee states sentencing recommendations to Counts 1, 3 & 4.  Atty Johnson states that he has not received the PSI and asks for a recess to go over that with his client.
BY THE COURT:  Recess

BACK ON THE RECORD:
Atty Johnson reviewed the PSI with his client and there is no changes. Court questions the state regarding Traffic tickets.  Atty Hendee states that the traffic tickets will remain to be dismissed.
Atty Johnson states tha the defendant withdraws his plea.  
BY THE COURT:  Court will permit the defendant to withdraw his plea from April 2017.

Atty Johnson waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.  Defendant agrees.
BY THE COURT:  Court accepts the waiver of the Preliminary Hearing.

Atty Johnson enters a No Contest plea to Counts 1, 3 & 4.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge. Court finds plea made freely, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the amended information for a factual basis.
  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Counts 1, 3 & 4.

Atty Hendee moves to dismiss Ct. 2 and asks the court to follow the joint recommendation.
Atty Johnson makes sentencing arguments.  Atty Johnson asks that the probation be transferred due to the transfer fee already been paid.
Defendant makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  Ct. 1, OWI - 6th offense:  Impose and Stay; 6 years in the Wisconsin State Prison System with 3 years Initial Confinement and 3 years Extended Supervision with conditions:
3 years Probation with conditions
Probation may be transferred to Washington
*6 months in the Marquette County Jail
*Credit = 108 days (may be applied to the conditional jail time)
*Good Time
*Pay fine and costs = $1,794.00
*Maintain Absolute Sobriety
*Comply with any and all counseling recommended by the Agent
*DNA Sample
*36 months DL Revocation
*24 months Ignition Interlock (once the license is active again)
*AODA and any follow-up treatment

  **Court advises defendant that they have been convicted of a Felony and advises rights of voting privileges and of owning a firearm.

Ct. 3, Obstructing an Officer:  9 months in the Marquette County Jail; consecutive to any other sentence
*Court Costs = $243.00
*DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge
*Electronic Monitoring

Ct. 4, Obstructing an Officer:  6 months in the Marquette County Jail; consecutive to Ct. 3
*Court costs = $243.00
*DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge
*Electronic monitoring

Cash bond to be applied; balance to be paid while on Probation

Sentencing hearing on June 8, 2017 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Philip M. Bradshaw in court with attorney Steven Michael Cohen.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that there is an agreement for 5 prior convictions.  Atty Cohen agrees.
BY THE COURT:  Per agreement, 5 prior convictions.

Court questions Atty Cohen on the motions of the State.  Atty Cohen responds and has no objections.
BY THE COURT:  State's Motions granted.

Atty Cohen states that the defendant would like to plea to the charge.  Court questions the defense regarding the traffic tickets.  Atty Cohen states that the defendant would like to take care of those today.
BY THE COURT:  Recess to give the defendant time to fill out paperwork.

BACK ON THE RECORD:
Atty Cohen is prepared to proceed.
  Atty Hendee states plea agreement to Ct. 2.  Ct. 1 to be dismissed.  Atty Cohen enters a Guilty plea to Ct. 2.  Atty Cohen asks that the traffic matters be dismissed.  Atty Hendee will dismiss 15TR511 but the defendant will have to plea to 15TR510.  Atty Cohen agrees with that.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees and enters a Guilty plea to 15CF22 and 15TR510.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the information for a factual basis.  
Defendant agrees to the 5 prior convictions.

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of  Ct. 2 in 15CF22 and 15TR510.
Court makes a finding on the 5 previous convictions listed in the criminal complaint.

Atty Hendee questions the court regarding a PSI.
Atty Cohen questions the court regarding a PSI and states that the defense is not requesting a PSI.
BY THE COURT:  Court orders a PSI.
Set for Sentencing.

Atty Cohen asks for a recess to speak with his client.
BY THE COURT:  Recess

BACK ON THE RECORD:
Atty Cohen has discussed the matter with his client.
BY THE COURT:  Ct. 2 dismissed.
15TR511 to be dismissed.
15TR510 = Pay forfieture of $200.50
Set for Sentencing.
  **Court advises defendant that they have been convicted of a Felony and advises rights of voting privileges and of owning a firearm.
Defendant is remanded into custody.
Bond is withdrawn.
Payment plan for forfieture will be taken up at the time of sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 8, 2017 at 10:00 am.
Telephone conference on March 31, 2017 at 01:00 pm.

Court trial on April 3, 2017 at 09:00 am.
15TR510 & 15TR511 tracking w/15CF22

Defendant Philip M. Bradshaw in court with attorney Steven Michael Cohen.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15TR510 & 15TR511 tracking:
Atty Hendee states that in speaking with Atty Cohen; the defendant does not wish to proceed with a plea.  Atty Cohen responds and states that the defendant's beliefs were that he would be able to transfer to his home State prison.  Atty Cohen asks that the matter be reset to an argued sentencing.

BY THE COURT:  Set for Court Trial
bond continued  Court trial scheduled for April 3, 2017 at 09:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 15, 2017 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Philip M. Bradshaw in court with attorney Steven Michael Cohen.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that this was set for trial tomorrow; there has been many discussions on possible settlement and believes the parties do have resolution on the matter.  Atty Hendee states that parties will be asking the sentencing to be set in February 2017.  Atty Cohen agrees and states that the defendant has some work obligations that he needs to handle.  Atty Cohen states that the defendant will waive the Jury Trial.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant waives his right to a Jury Trial.

BY THE COURT:  Jury Trial was waived by Defendant.
Set for Plea/Sentencing
bond continued.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 15, 2017 at 11:00 am.

Atty Cohen states that he has met with the DA regarding resolution of the case.  Atty Cohen asks for a little more time to speak with the DA.

BY THE COURT:  Set for Telephone Status.
bond continued.  Telephone scheduling conference scheduled for March 17, 2016 at 09:15 am.
Return date at 01-07-2016 02:30 pm

Defendant Philip M. Bradshaw in court with attorney Steven Michael Cohen.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15TR510 & 15TR511 tracking:
Atty Hendee states that in speaking with Atty Cohen; the defendant will be waiving the Prelim today.  Atty Cohen agrees and has discussed the waiver with his client.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the waiver.  Court accepts the waiver of the Prelim.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.

Atty Hendee files the information with the Court.  Atty Cohen states that the Defendant received a copy of the information and waives its reading.    Defendant stands mute.  Attorney request the Court enter a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.

  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.
Set for Return.
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for January 7, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Philip M. Bradshaw by video, in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee requests significant cash bond of $5,000.00 with conditions.  Defendant makes statement regarding bond.
